Yes, many companies face similar challenges with getting their suppliers to comply with their sustainability standards. These challenges can arise for several reasons, such as differences in cultural norms, lack of awareness, and cost.

Additionally, some suppliers may not have the resources or capabilities to fully understand or implement sustainability practices, or they may have other priorities that make sustainability a lower priority. In some cases, suppliers may also view sustainability as a burden or an additional cost that they are reluctant to take on.

To overcome these challenges, companies are taking different approaches, such as sharing knowledge on sustainability best practices, collaborating with suppliers to develop solutions that work for both parties, and offering incentives or penalties to encourage compliance.

Ultimately, addressing sustainability challenges requires a collaborative effort between companies and their suppliers. Many companies are recognizing the importance of sustainability and are taking steps to ensure that their supply chains are in line with their sustainability goals.
